> As WHEELIE spoke, there was a collective roar from the TERRORCONS as
=
> their humor turned to anger and then even rage!
> 
> "I do not smell like=
 snot!" BLOT yelled out.
> 
> RIPPERSNAPPER turned over to him, "Actually y=
ou do!" He smiled wickedly.
> 
> Then there was another roar as GRIMLOCK st=
epped foward followed by his
> DINOBOTS. "Me Grimlock say Wheelie needs our=
 help! Dinobots attack
> Terrorcons!"
> 
> "NO!!" Yelled BACKSTOP who's voi=
ce somehow managed to rise above the
> noise. The volume caused the others =
to pause for a moment.
> 
> BACKSTOP looked from the DINOBOTS to the TERROR=
CONS. "No." He said
> more quietly this time. "We have a bigger target then=
 ourselves."
> 
> "And just what's is that?" HUN-GRR said in derisive tones=
.
> 
> Pulling out a small device BACKSTOP looked again to the TERRORCONS a=
nd
> DINOBOTS, "Our true foe is Magmatron!"
> 
> Pressing a button on the d=
evice a portal opened, and through it the
> sounds of a battle could be hea=
rd.
> 
>

WHEELIE paused, "Who or what is MAGMATRON?  And why does his name=
 mean something that smells very strong?"  Just glancing overa t the TERROR=
CONS, then over at BACKSTOP.  "I think that we can just say this day, is os=
meone else's problem to deal with this way.   And I WHEELIE say we walk awa=
y."

He didn't care for the endless feuding of the factions, he cared for h=
is friends.  He trusted RODIMUS would come otu of anything all right, but h=
e wouldn't be rushing in to save anyone other than those his loyalty was to=
, which was NOT the MAXIMALS.
